places.name: Arch House
description: The first settlement founded in Bunny Snek. The various cave networks, connected to Arch House by several stone bridges. provided the bountiful resources for the base.
As the first settlement, it has the honour of being the only base in the world with a complete world map.

places.name: Struggle Village
description: The village was once constantly besieged by monsters, until it had only two survivors left. Since then, it has fully recovered and has become the most successful settlement in Bunny Snek. It serves as a central Nether hub where many other settlements can be reached. The base is located in a mountain hideout near the village's church, in the northern part of the village.
Some notable landmarks in Struggle are the automatic sugar cane farm, the kelp farm, the Raid memorial banner, and the Memory Hole.

places.name: Roselook Village
description: The first village discovered in Bunny Snek, spotted from high atop Roselook Hill.

Monster sieges once reduced the population of the village to a single villager, nearly dooming it. To save it, a long underground railway was built connecting Roselook to Struggle via Arch House. Ironically, villagers from the now booming Struggle Village were migrated to Roselook in order to repopulate it.

places.name: Cornflower Village
description: A small village built on the slopes of Cornflower Mountain. It was discovered during a survey to find a land route between Roselook and Soaking.

places.name: Uneven Village
description: A village located on the northern end of Uneven Swamp. Was thought to be settled by villagers, but it is now know to be abandoned.

places.name: Respite House
description: A base founded after escaping the first treacherous trek through the Shores of No Respite in the Nether.
The lack of respite continues as the portal here serves as a connection to Bunflower Village to the far east, via the Great Repsite-Bunflower Tunnel and treks through hostile territory in the Nether.

places.name: Ender Base
description: A strange cubic room found in the Groan Mineshaft that was occupied by a single Enderman. Now it is a rest stop for those exploring the mines.
The water route between here and Bunflower Village passes through an ocean monument.

places.name: Cut Hamlet
description: The village that never was. The first base built after the 1.19 update.
It was intially a village that started to generate in 1.17, but was never finished due to the changes in world generation in 1.19.

places.name: World Origin
description: Formerly a simple dirt marker located at Bunny Snek's origin, now it's the start of a livable base. Replaces the original plan to establish a base at Spawn Point. There are plans to build a tower that extends to the world's build limit in the sky and deep underground.

places.name: Birch Base
description: The first settlement established after crossing the 1.18 Sea, past Arch House Area's Eastern Frontier.

places.name: River Maze Checkpoint
description: This base was meant to be a temporary checkpoint for those who needed a rest after boating across the Darkwood Lagoons fromn the north or navigating the River Maze from the south. The cave systems found at the bottoms of the Lilac Ravine and Inevitable Falls Cave and their plentiful resources have made this base a necessary drop-off point.
A tower had been constructed as a viewing platform, allowing one to survey the River Maze forest.

places.name: Superpoint Caverns
description: This base was established to facilitate the exploration of Superpoint Caverns, located deep below the River Maze, without having to trek back to the River Maze Checkpoint. This is the first base to have been delibrately set up deep underground.
Exploration has been limited as the base's mob neighbours still need to be cleared out of the immediate area.

places.name: Reverse Oasis
description: A base located beside the Reverse Oasis: two lakes that form a clearing in the middle of dense Heavy Woods.
Being surrounded by dense forest and rivers,  this base is rather isolated and difficult to access by land and water. The only nether connection available is via Superpoint Caverns.

places.name: Sprawling Cave
description: This base was founded during an expedition to map out the Wooded Lands.

places.name: Soaking Village
description: This village was once terrorized by the Illagers of Soaking Outpost to the south. After they were cleared out, they organized one final raid on the villager, but were ultimately defeated.
Soaking is the home of the first automated mob grinder in Bunny Snek.

places.name: Savanna Dam Village
description: The most prosperous village in the Soaking Savanna region. It sits atop the Diamond Savanna Mine and is the home of the first automatic chicken cooker.

places.name: Shattered Village
description: The gateway between the Soaking Savanna and Arch House Area regions. The structure of this village had been distorted by the 1.18 update; however, the village had already been long abandoned. A repopulation project is underway, by immigrating villagers from the Savanna Dam and Cornflower Villages.
Shattered Village is surrounded by numerous natural landmarks, such as the Triple Spire Caverns, Stalactite Thicket Caverns and Crate Lake, and the Split Feelings Forest.

places.name: Bloodblast Base
description: This base mainly serves as a connection between Beep Beep Sheep Mountain in the Overworld with Bloodblast Forest in the nether.

places.name: Azurelion Village
description: A mountainside village covered in a meadow of its two namesake flowers: the azure bluet and dandelion.

The steep terrain makes travelling around the village a bit challenging, and this same steep terrain helped the village survive its first raid. Many Illagers fell and were trapped by the nearby crevasses and steep river valley.

places.name: Matchstick Village
description: The small, seculded neighbours of Azurelion Village. Despite its small size, it has a booming population.

places.name: Turtle Golem Village
description: The western marine gateway to the Para-Arch Area, one of the three villages that make up the region.
After a raid on the Otter Delta Outpost to the far north, the Illagers sought revenge by attack this village.

places.name: Beaver Dam Village
description: One of the three villages that make up the Para-Arch Area.

places.name: Turtle-Beaver Resevoir
description: The Nether gateway to the Para-Arch area. Originally planned to be built in between Turtle Golem Village and Beaver Dam Village, the sheltered resevoir of the current location was a more attractive choice.

places.name: Otter Dam Village
description: One of the three villages that make up the Para-Arch Area.

places.name: Bastion Crevasse
description: This base mainly serves as a connection between the Overworld and Angry Boar Bastion in the Nether.

places.name: Shattered Lands
description: This base was established to study the strange, clashing biomes in the Shattered Lands.

places.name: Canine Bank
description: Built on the banks of the Otter River and near the Otter Delta Outpost, this base gets a lot of wolf and fox visitors.

The Canine Basalt Delta in the Nether was named after this base, which in turn gave its name to the Canine Basalt Domain to the north. The base itself is not part of the Canine Basalt Domain, but it does serve as its southern gateway connection the Domain with Ring Rivers.

places.name: Pretzel River Heights
description: This base was established to be a halfway point of several routes between Canine Bank Base and the various settlements in the Para-Arch Area.
Originally, the base was established in the Pretzel River Resevoir to the south, but the terrain and vantage point of Pretzel River Heights deem to be a better choice.

places.name: Stony Bar Village
description: A village built on the cliffside, protected from the sea by stony shores. The natural cave system within the shore made it a good location to set up a base, despite the occasional Drowned visitor.

places.name: Hoverblock Village
description: The base itself is located slightly east of the village, inside an arch formation similar to Arch House.

The portal on the nether side is located in the heart of the Canine Basalt Delta. In the beginning, journeys between here and Canine Bank Base were treacherous and many lives have been lost just trying to secure the portal itself. Because of this, the Underdog Tunnel was constructed as a safer passage between the two settlements. Magama Cubes still find their way into the tunnel, but fighting them in the narrow tunnels is much more managable than out in the open.

Finding a safe path through the delta northward to Bunflower Village had proven to be even more dangerous, due to the extreme terrain. After many struggles, the Underdog Tunnel was built connecting to the Great Respite-Bunflower Tunnel, finally allowing quick passage between the two settlements.

places.name: Bunflower Village
description: A beautiful village sandwiched between a river and a sea of flowers.
The house base established in this village was hastily built, just so there could be a safe place to stay.

In the past, a path southward through the Canine Basalt Delta to Hoverblock Village had not been found, so the Great Respite-Bunflower Tunnel was constructed connecting the nether portal to Respite House instead. A special platform had to be constructed in order for the two portals on either side to connect properly. Magma Cubes and Ghasts kept assaulting the platform during construction. In the present, the Underdog Tunnel had been built connecting to the Great Respite-Bunflower Tunnel, finally allowing quick passage between Bunflower and Hoverblock Villages.

places.name: Village of Boreal Bounty
description: A small, but prosperous village. Its offered much resources when it was discovered.
